'''Elulindo''' was the son of [[Olwë#Other versions of the legendarium|Elwë]], Lord of the [[Falmari|Teleri]], according to the early version of the [[legendarium]] from a genealogical table created by [[Tolkien]] in the early 1930s.

The table has not been published but [[Christopher Tolkien]] mentioned the name in his comments on the genealogies of the ''[[Quenta Noldorinwa]]'' period in the Appendix to ''[[The Lost Road and Other Writings]]''.<ref>{{LR|A1}}, p. 403</ref>

In the later versions of ''[[The Silmarillion]]'' the name of the father of Elulindo was changed from ''Elwë'' to ''[[Olwë]]''. Olwë is said to have had many sons, but none of them are known by name, nor have their deeds been recorded.<ref>{{S|5}}.</ref>

== Etymology ==
''Elulindo'' was probably conceived as a [[Telerin]] name at the time, comprised of the elements ''[[Elu]]'' (his father's Telerin name) + ''[[lindo]]'' ("singer, singing bird").<ref>{{LR|Etymologies}}, entry '''ƷEL'''</ref><ref>{{webcite|author=[[Paul Strack]]|articleurl=http://eldamo.org/content/words/word-2131606681.html|articlename=T. ''Elulindo'' m.|website=Eldamo|accessed=26 August 2022}}</ref>
